Package edu.cnm.deepdive.security

Class Diceware

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.security.Diceware

  • public class Diceware
extends java.lang.Object
    The Diceware class implements a Diceware-based passphrase generator, using a word list provided in the constructor invocation.
    Author:
    Freddie Romero

        Parameters:
        file - file to read for word list.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file does not exist.
        java.io.IOException - if file can't be read.

      • setRng

        public void setRng​(java.util.Random rng)

        Parameters:

      • generate

        public java.lang.String[] generate​(int length,
                                   boolean duplicatesAllowed)
                            throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Generate and returns (in a String[]) a password of the specified length. THe inclusion of duplicates is controlled by the duplicatatesAllowed argument. If the specified length is greater than the number of words in the words list, and duplicates aren't allowed, then an infinite loop will result.
        Parameters:
        length -
        duplicatesAllowed -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm for default strong source of randomness is not available.
